> Donny Bravo wrote:
> > 1. What is the optimum temperature of the Earth?
>

> So human have to move, we'll adapt, or maybe something else will
> take our place, the Earth doesn't really care, I'm sure.
> 
> > 2. What is the optimum percentage of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.
>

Exactly. And, what's optimum for Sweden is not optimum for Indonesia. 
So, who is going to decide where it's warm and where it's cold? Which 
countries get the ideal climate for growing wheat, or rice, or bananas?

I don't think we can alter the climate in any significant way at this 
point, but, if we can, then that ability is just another weapon of mass 
destruction.

> > 3. Why did we have global cooling through the 1950s, 1960s and half of 
> > the 1970s?
> 
> Didn't someone say it was aerosols?

Gee, bring 'em back. Problem solved. I miss 'em anyway.
